entry.dcterms:title: Social Effect and Efficiency of Social Policy in Hungary 2000
entry.dcterms:creator: Nagy, Ildikó
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F43: Social Effect and Efficiency of Social Policy in Hungary 2000. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19
entry.dcterms:creator: Ferge, Zsuzsa
entry.dcterms:contributor: Loránd Eötvös University Institute of Sociology and Social Policy
entry.dcterms:description: subjective experience of poverty, freedom and security; to what extent individuals consider certain freedoms important (press, religion, property etc.), to what extent they see this guaranteed, how they see the responsibility of the state, how tax-consciousness appears among them
entry.dcterms:subject: income, property and savings
economic policy
equality and inequality
social stratification and groupings
social conditions and indicators
political institutions, public administration
social welfare policy and systems
person
survey data
cross-section

Two-stage stratified national representative random sample. The primary sampling units (settlements) nagyságukkal were included with a probability in proportion to their size, and then within the selected units an equal number of persons were randomly selected to be included in the sample. The source of the settlements in the sample was the T-STAR database purchased from the Hungarian Central Statistical Office (KSH), as well as the database purchased from the Central Központi Data Processing, Electoral and Registration Office (these are the most recent data describing the constant population by settlements). The addresses of the persons were selected from the purchased Central Központi Data Processing, Electoral and Registration Office sample.
face-to-face interview
A
